text: - [Narrator] Developers have more tools

and services available to
automate software delivery
than ever before.

But these tools don't
always work well together,

and some of them aren't
designed for working
with Amazon Web Services.

That results in developers
spending time on tools

and infrastructure
instead of writing code.

What if there was a way to
set up the tools you need

to plan, code, build, test
and deploy applications
in a few minutes
and use it all as a service on AWS?

Today's developers need
a catalyst for change.
With Amazon CodeCatalyst,

dev teams can accelerate
tooling setup and integration,
automate development and deployment tasks,
and collaborate without friction.
It all starts with project blueprints.

Blueprints define the
application infrastructure,
code repository, CICD automation,
and working sample code you need
to build and deploy your apps.
Love your current dev tool?

CodeCatalyst's modular
design lets you swap
in third-party technologies.

Flexible, actions-based
workflows yield robust CICD
from the start,

and cloud-hosted dev
environments integrate seamlessly

with popular IDEs so you
can build from anywhere.
These consistent automated environments
even help simplify the process

of deploying your
applications to production.
Need to team up on your software?

CodeCatalyst enables fluid
collaboration on AWS.
Invite colleagues via email

and provide access to
projects with full context
to edit, test, and commit code.

And issue management is
enabled for every project.
So even as your team grows,

CodeCatalyst helps to
empower their work together.

Stop waiting to add automation
and DevOps best practices
to your software projects.
Join the developers igniting the next era

of reliable, repeatable
software innovation.
Get started today
and see why CodeCatalyst is the best way
to deploy applications on AWS.
